export_format.description: Three-part export: (1) Clinical data as C-CDA R2.1 XML documents, (2) Discrete data as 27 CSV files covering PM, EMR, audit, and QPP domains, (3) Document Repository as original-format files (PDF, BMP, JPG, TIF, GIF, DOC, XLS, MPG, AVI, etc.). Text documents converted to PDF; others exported in native format.

documentation.notes: All documentation is on a single HTML page. Each of the 27 CSV tables has field-level descriptions and a sample record. No separate PDF or ZIP download offered. No formal data types specified (descriptions are prose, not typed). Approximately 601 field definitions total across all tables.

clinical.evidence: C-CDA R2.1 section covers USCDI V1: Allergies, Assessment/Plan, Care Team, Clinical Notes, Goals, Health Concerns, Immunizations, Labs, Medications, Demographics, Problems, Procedures, Provenance, Smoking Status, UDI, Vital Signs. CSV tables include CLALLRGY, CLLAB, CLPROBLM, CLRXHIST, CLVITAL, CLDISPENSE, CLPNOTES, CLFAMILY, CLORDER.

secure_messages.evidence: CLMAIL.CSV - Patient Messages (PM/EMR) with 19 fields including From User, To User, Msg Name, Msg Text, Send Status, File Name, Attachment, Provider Name. Example shows inter-staff messages.

billing_financial.evidence: CLCLAIM.CSV - Patient Claims with 34 fields (Diag 1-4, Pre Auth, Primary/Secondary/Tertiary Insurance, Fee Type, Ins Form). PAYMENTS.CSV with 16 fields (Pay Date, Payor Code, Pay Amount, Charge Id, Insurance Carrier). BALANCE.CSV with balances (Account Balance, Insurance Due, Patient Due, Unpaid Deductible). Statements.CSV for patient statements. CLCNOTES.CSV for collection notes. zQualityPayCharge.CSV for QPP/MIPS codes.

insurance_coverage.evidence: CLAUTHRZ.CSV - Patient Authorizations with 21 fields (Auth No, Status, Ins Carrier, # Allowed, # Appt Used). CLCLAIM.CSV includes Primary/Secondary/Tertiary Insurance fields. PAYMENTS.CSV has Insurance Carrier field. APPOINTMENTS.CSV has Eligibility field.

appointments_scheduling.evidence: APPOINTMENTS.CSV with 30 fields: Appt Date, ApptTime, Book, Reason, Appt Description, Allotted, Tag Date/Time, Room Time, Finish Time, Status, Appt Flag, Create Date/Time, Arrival Time, Facility, Anesthesia Used, Stat, Eligibility, etc.

documents_images.evidence: Document Repository section: exports all electronic documents in original formats (PDF, BMP, JPG, TIF, GIF, DOC, XLS, MPG, AVI). Text converted to PDF, others in native format. Syntax: Filename, Date and Provider. CLINBOXLOG.CSV tracks imported documents.

audit_trails.evidence: CLACTIVITYLOG.CSV - Chart Activity (Audit) with 10 fields: Event ID, Timestamp, Group, Code, Description, User Name, Status. Example shows CHART Open events. CLINBOXLOG.CSV - Patient Inbox Import Log (Audit) tracks document imports.

sample_exports_notes: Each CSV table section includes a Record Example with realistic sample data (e.g., sample appointment, sample claim, sample payment). These are inline in the HTML, not downloadable sample files.
issues: No downloadable PDF or ZIP version of the documentation — the HTML page is the only format
No formal data types specified for CSV fields (descriptions are narrative prose only)
No schema definition (DDL, JSON Schema, XSD) provided
No value sets or code enumerations documented for coded fields (e.g., appointment Status, Appt Flag values)
Container/packaging format for the actual export not documented (how are the CSV files + C-CDA + documents bundled?)
C-CDA section references external HL7/ONC specs rather than providing vendor-specific mapping details
summary: MedInformatix provides comprehensive EHI export documentation on a single public HTML page covering three export formats: C-CDA R2.1 for clinical data (USCDI V1), 27 CSV files for discrete data (PM, EMR, audit, QPP), and a document repository for original-format files. The CSV documentation includes field-level descriptions and sample records for all 27 tables (~601 total fields), covering clinical data, billing/claims, payments, insurance authorizations, appointments, messages, audit trails, and documents. This is a genuine database-level export, not a FHIR re-export — tables like CLCLAIM, PAYMENTS, BALANCE, CLAUTHRZ, and CLACTIVITYLOG expose PM and audit data that would not be available through FHIR APIs.
